snippet: As President Obama increasingly turns to unilateral action to achieve policy goals, activists and businesses are coming forward with their wish lists and making their case out of public view.
abstract: Pres Obama’s appetite for the use of executive order on issues like immigration, tax policy and gay rights has emboldened activists to flock to the administration with their policy wish lists; it also has exposed Obama, already facing charges of executive overreach, to criticism that he is presiding over opaque policy-making, with the potential to reward political backers at the expense of other interests.
lead_paragraph: As President Obama increasingly turns to unilateral action to achieve policy goals, activists and businesses are coming forward with their wish lists and making their case out of public view.

headline.main: Behind Closed Doors, Obama Crafts Executive Actions
headline.print_headline: Obama’s Use of Executive Power Spurs Intense Lobbying, Often in Private
